Class SynchronizedQueue<T>

java.lang.Object
SynchronizedQueue<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of data items
public class SynchronizedQueue<T> extends Object
A synchronized bounded-size queue for multithreaded producer-consumer applications.

  • Constructor Details

    • SynchronizedQueue

      public SynchronizedQueue(int capacity)
      Constructor. Allocates a buffer (an array) with the given capacity and resets pointers and counters.
      Parameters:
      capacity - Buffer capacity

  • Method Details

    • dequeue

      public T dequeue()
      Dequeues the first item from the queue and returns it. If the queue is empty but producers are still registered to this queue, this method blocks until some item is available. If the queue is empty and no more items are planned to be added to this queue (because no producers are registered), this method returns null.
      Returns:
      The first item, or null if there are no more items
      See Also:
      • registerProducer()
      • unregisterProducer()

    • enqueue

      public void enqueue(T item)
      Enqueues an item to the end of this queue. If the queue is full, this method blocks until some space becomes available.
      Parameters:
      item - Item to enqueue

    • getCapacity

      public int getCapacity()
      Returns the capacity of this queue
      Returns:
      queue capacity

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the current size of the queue (number of elements in it)
      Returns:
      queue size

    • registerProducer

      public void registerProducer()
      Registers a producer to this queue. This method actually increases the internal producers counter of this queue by 1. This counter is used to determine whether the queue is still active and to avoid blocking of consumer threads that try to dequeue elements from an empty queue, when no producer is expected to add any more items. Every producer of this queue must call this method before starting to enqueue items, and must also call unregisterProducer() when finishes to enqueue all items.
      See Also:
      • dequeue()
      • unregisterProducer()

    • unregisterProducer

      public void unregisterProducer()
      Unregisters a producer from this queue. See registerProducer().
      See Also:
      • dequeue()
      • registerProducer()
